Message.Title: Dubai lender Emirates NBD launches $1 bln bond at 5.75 pct
Message.Msg: May 22 - Emirates NBD launched a $1 billion core capital-boosting bond on Wednesday, amid healthy demand, allowing the Dubai lender to tighten earlier price guidance. The Tier 1 bond launched at a final yield of 5.75 percent, tighter than the 6 percent indicated earlier in the day. Pricing is due later on Wednesday. Bank of America MERRILL LYNCH, Deutsche Bank , HSBC Holdings, ING, Morgan Stanley as well as Emirates NBD's investment banking unit are mandated arrangers on the bond.

Message.Title: ZAGG-WILL JUMP TO $6 WAY OVELSOLD FOUND BOTTOM-NEWS-NEW PRODUCT FOR S4 & IPAD
Message.Msg: n trading on Monday, shares of Zagg Inc (ZAGG_) entered into oversold territory, hitting an RSI reading of 28.7, after changing hands as low as $4.97 per share. By comparison, the current RSI reading of the S&P 500 ETF (SPY) is 67.4. A bullish investor could look at ZAGG's 28.7 RSI reading today as a sign that the recent heavy selling is in the process of exhausting itself, and begin to look for entry point opportunities on the buy side. Topic.Title: In one of these weeks over the next few weeks..............

Message.Msg: The hearing for the $8.5bn private label settlement lawsuit begins on May 30. Many expect the judge to approve it but it is not a rubber stamp approval......If approved there may be a 50 penny move to the upside because a portion of the judge approving it is built in....if it is not approved the downside is much greater.....suddenly a material amount of uncertainty is out there and I believe we lose $1.50 - 2.00.....the downside represents $15 - $20bn of market cap which represents a good guess at what the market thinks the incremental liabilities will be.....I am long and have been forever so this is not doom and gloom just a note to say be aware and keep an eye on that settlement hearing progress...

Topic.Title: BAC

Message.Msg: I think some of the settlement is priced in as most believe Article 77 will hold water.....the issue is I think the downside is way more than the upside on the court's decision....that's why I'm willing to sit out until a decision is rendered.....hopefully will not lose too much upside and can get in quickly after decision vs potentially having a really nice entry point due to the uncertainty created by non approval...

Topic.Title: Republicans have caused these horrible tornadoes by denying Global Warming

Message.Msg: Donut, most of the rest of the world is in agreement that something needs to be done about carbon emissions. Not to benefit Al Gore. The world is not in some sort of conspiracy to make Al Gore wealthy. The carbon tax idea is a vehicle to reduce carbon emissions and allow them where they are still necessary (like Grilling a good steak). The starkdirt mimics claim was that global warming is not a problem and wants to ignore it with his head in the sand. Most of the world likes to ignore it because reducing carbon emissions is inconvienient and requires changes in so many things we do. Not changes particularly in what we do but how we do them, like using gas instead of wood or coal, or electric cars or composting your yard trimmings instead of burning them. Not so long ago recycling was nothing but a concept. Now it is almost a necessity. We made changes there and we eventually will with carbon and no one is going to feel any more put out about it than those that feel upset that they can't throw their litter out of their car window as they drive down the road.
